articles.author: Stephen Fidler and Kim Mackrael
articles.title: Europe Is Tested Anew, This Time by Energy, Inflation and Putin - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Russian threat to gas supply combines with rising interest rates to endanger the EU’s economies, with German industry especially in the cross hairs. Political turmoil in Italy adds to risks.

articles.title: European study reveals potassium-rich foods reduce negative effect of salt in women's diets - Leitrim Live

articles.description: Investigate Europe drones out the noise to find out if technology does hold solutions to combat pesticides and protect ecosystems.

articles.title: ECB raises interest rates for the first time in more than a decade, ASX set for modest gains - ABC News
articles.description: The European Central Bank has raised interest rates for the first time in more than a decade, with financial markets generally taking the move in their stride.

articles.title: Russian and European astronauts conduct rare joint spacewalk - CNN
articles.description: Two astronauts — one European and one Russian — exited the airlock on the International Space Station for a spacewalk on Thursday, marking the first time in more than 20 years such a joint endeavor has taken place.

articles.title: Italy's Draghi resigns, spelling trouble for nation, Europe - CTV News
articles.description: Italy is headed for an early election after its president accepted Premier Mario Draghi's resignation Thursday and decided there was no possibility for cobbling together another government following the rapid collapse of the ruling coalition.
